isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: BENDIX 2150 - ASSEMBLY - FINAL ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: FINAL ASSEMBLY
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 11for numbers in parentheses.

step1.para: Place the cylinder head gasket (19) on the crankcase land position the head on the crankcase as marked during disassembly. A gasket sealer is neither required or recommended.
Secure the cylinder head to the crankcase using the four cylinder head cap screws (11). Tighten the capscrews in an "X" pattern as specified in the TORQUE CHART.
Using a thread sealant install all necessary pipe plugs and tighten as specified in the TORQUE CHART.

Install all crankshaft keys (30) making certain to support the crankshaft to avoid bearing damage. Install the crankshaft nut where applicable. When installing drive couplings, gears or pulleys, tighten the crankshaft nut (39) only as specified in the TORQUE CHART. The self locking crankshaft nut used on the BX-2150 requires that it be installed so that the narrow castellation slots are toward the end of the crankshaft and not against the pulley, coupling or gear that the nut retains.

Some BX-2150 through drive compressors require the installation of a spline coupling on the rear of the crankshaft. The cap screw securing the coupling should be tighten as specified in the TORQUE CHART.

Use covers, plugs, or masking tape to protect all ports if compressor is not to be installed immediately. Protect the ends of the crankshaft against damage by wrapping with masking tape or friction tape. The open bottom of a vertical engine lubricated compressors should be protected against the entrance of dirt during handling or storage, by installing a temporary cover over the base.
